Mods that are based on stock parts and look like they were made by Squad. And no,UbioZur is not one of theese,because it only welds already existing parts.

-RLA stockalike and other ones from Hoojiwana

-KSPX

-Most of TouhouTorpedo's mods

-Rubber Band Inc. tracks

-Taverio's Pizza and Aerospace

-Habitat pack

-SPUE

StarShine Industries also has a very nice stocklike parts pack.

http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/40220-0-23-StarShine-Industries-Athena-Pack-Revamped!
In the thread of the FTmN series Nuclear Rockets, you will find at the very bottom an unassuming little paragraph with a download link. It's only a single part, but I think it's done really well.
What exactly qualifies as stockalike?
Stockalike, by general consensus, is mod parts that looks and act sort of like you'd expect them to if SQUAD ever actually put them in the game themselves. Ish.
I expect Squad textures to look crap. I don't get it. I wouldn't call Porkjet's Mk2 parts stockalike, and if they are why aren't B9 parts stockalike?

Well, besides the needless insult to the SQUAD texture artists, the biggest reason would be that PorkJet describes his own work as stock-alike, but B9 does not. beyond that porkjet doesn't look like B9 but does look a lot like stock.

Well, besides the needless insult to the SQUAD texture artists...

Don't just throw accusations around like that. Learn to distinguish between personal attacks and criticisms. One of them is reasonable. Most stock part textures look really bad. I mean really amateurish. I don't care if it hurts anyone's feelings; it's the truth, it's also NOT a value judgement of the texture artist. Maybe they had to hurry. That's fine. I don't care; it's not relevant to the observation.

Don't just throw accusations around like that. Learn to distinguish between personal attacks and criticisms. One of them is reasonable. Most stock part textures look really bad. I mean really amateurish. I don't care if it hurts anyone's feelings; it's the truth, it's also NOT a value judgement of the texture artist. Maybe they had to hurry. That's fine. I don't care; it's not relevant to the observation.

I see what you mean. A personal attack would be calling the texture artist a moron because the textures aren't good, I assume

Alright back on topic before this ends up in tears.

OP: Perhaps you should add a few pictures and/or imgur albums along with the mods so that people can see what they look like without necessarily clicking through all the links?

Its hard to put it in words. KSP-look is fairly realistic and detailed, but slightly stylized and simplified with exeggerated proportions like an animated movie. Theres details like dirt and scratches and some shading on the parts, but kept quite simple. Colors are mostly greys, not any color tint, some orange, some yellow and a few little exeptions to that scheme. Proportions are slightly dumpy, e.g. engine bells are often a bit shorter and wider than in reality. All the textures are hand-painted and diliberately look like they were. No photographic texture elements are used with very few exceptions.

B9 uses completely flat colors, the outsides of the parts are almost exclusively in that middle grey. Many parts are decorated with those white stripes. There are painted scratches on the parts but they are kept simple. Interiors and end-pieces are more colorful like yellow/orange and light blue in the big cargobays. Concave bits mostly have some ambient shadowing that looks like it was computer-generated.

edit: sry stupid_chris you ninja'd me. But well since this is a thread about stockalike parts I guess this isnt too far off opic.

We're talking about rocket parts, not C7 aerospace parts. C7 parts are crap, and Chad admits this. The Rockomax, LV-T, and Probodobodyne, etc parts all look great. A good art style that fits the game.
